info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 3:20AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN SEBASTIAN AND EASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES... At 319 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southwest of Excelsior, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Greenwood... Pocola... Hackett... Huntington... Bonanza... Midland... Cameron... Washburn... Excelsior... Burnville... Jenny Lind... Rock Island... Arkola... Crossroads... Witcherville... Dayton... Rye Hill... Milltown... Jenson... This includes Interstate 540 near mile marker 14. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
